title.native: 俺だけレベルアップな件 Season 2 -Arise from the Shadow-
title.romaji: Ore dake Level Up na Ken: Season 2 - Arise from the Shadow
title.english: Solo Leveling Season 2 -Arise from the Shadow-

description:
The second season of Solo Leveling.

Mastering his new abilities in secret, Jin-U must battle humanity's toughest foes to save his mother.

(Source: Crunchyroll News)
synonyms: 俺だけレベルアップな件 第2期
Ore dake Level Up na Ken 2nd Season

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/p1b9f44vegyae8n)

Affiliated with [Dangun Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6521/). Initially worked as a production assistant.

His work on the 34th episode of [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/) attracted a lot of attention within the industry, as well as his more recent work in [Sword Art Online: Alicization](https://anilist.co/anime/100182/), in which he mostly teamed-up with [Kentarou Waki](https://anilist.co/staff/146156/).
Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Currently freelance with ties to [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/).

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/theshoefactory2) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/benjamin_dj_anderson/)

__Benjamin Anderson__ is an English vocalist and lyricist living in Japan known to frequently collaborate with [Hiroyuki Sawano](https://anilist.co/staff/103509/Hiroyuki-Sawano) in his vocal project SawanoHiroyuki[nZk].

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.
